title: Identifying Negative Thought Patterns
summary: Learn to recognize and label unhelpful or automatic negative thoughts that influence your mood and behavior.

details.content: Negative thought patterns can distort reality and contribute to feelings of anxiety, depression, and low self-esteem. Identifying them is the first step toward change.
You notice that you often think, 'I always mess things up,' after making a small mistake at school.

content: Keep a thought diary to track negative thoughts throughout the day.
Notice when your mood shifts and ask yourself what you were thinking.
Label common patterns, such as 'all-or-nothing thinking' or 'catastrophizing.'

title: Challenging Cognitive Distortions
summary: Actively question and reframe distorted or irrational thoughts to develop a more balanced perspective.

details.content: Cognitive distortions can lead to unnecessary distress and unhelpful behaviors. Challenging them helps you respond more rationally and feel better.
When you think, 'Nobody likes me,' you challenge it by recalling times friends have invited you out.

content: Ask yourself, 'Is there evidence for this thought?'
Consider alternative explanations for events.
Practice replacing negative thoughts with more realistic ones.

title: Developing Healthy Coping Mechanisms
summary: Build and use positive strategies to manage stress, difficult emotions, and challenging situations.

details.content: Healthy coping skills reduce the impact of stress and prevent reliance on unhelpful behaviors like avoidance or self-criticism.
Instead of withdrawing when upset, you talk to a trusted friend or go for a walk.

content: Make a list of activities that help you feel calm or supported.
Try deep breathing, journaling, or listening to music when stressed.
Reach out for support when needed.

title: Mindfulness and Relaxation Techniques
summary: Use mindfulness and relaxation exercises to stay present and reduce anxiety or overwhelm.

details.content: Mindfulness helps you observe thoughts and feelings without judgment, making it easier to manage stress and respond thoughtfully.
When feeling anxious before a test, you practice mindful breathing to calm your nerves.

content: Set aside a few minutes daily for mindful breathing or body scans.
Try progressive muscle relaxation or guided imagery.
Notice your senses and surroundings to anchor yourself in the present.

title: Setting and Achieving Goals
summary: Learn to set realistic, specific goals and break them into manageable steps to build motivation and self-efficacy.

details.content: Goal-setting provides direction and a sense of accomplishment, which can boost mood and confidence.
You set a goal to improve your math grade by studying 20 minutes each day and tracking your progress.

content: Use the SMART framework: Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound.
Break big goals into smaller, actionable steps.
Celebrate progress, even small wins.

title: Building Self-Esteem and Confidence
summary: Practice self-acceptance and positive self-talk to strengthen your sense of self-worth.

details.content: Healthy self-esteem helps you cope with setbacks, try new things, and maintain positive relationships.
You remind yourself of your strengths and achievements when you feel insecure.

content: List your strengths and accomplishments regularly.
Challenge negative self-talk with affirmations.
Set boundaries and treat yourself with kindness.

title: Problem-Solving Skills
summary: Learn a step-by-step approach to tackle challenges and make effective decisions.

details.content: Strong problem-solving skills reduce feelings of helplessness and increase your ability to handle life's difficulties.
When you have a conflict with a friend, you brainstorm solutions and choose the best way to address it.

content: Define the problem clearly.
Generate multiple possible solutions.
Weigh pros and cons before choosing an action.
Reflect on the outcome and adjust as needed.
